title: re-start
author: re-start
content: After about 3 months, I am here again. After reading your replays and your support, I got a lot of motivation! But this is not the whole story.You can find Teaching Bitcoin To My Friends (Part 1) here. (The whole story started here)When I started my weekly meeting, after a while, I noticed that some of my friends can't come to my house. I live in a rainy city; sometimes, the rains continue for months, and my friends cannot come to my house on rainy days.So I decided to start online classes. Every Friday, we have a friendly meeting for 2 hours, and we talk about Bitcoin and all the important events that affect the market.If you also want to join this group, I can create a discord server where we can talk and have a friendly meeting every week. I'll read your replays, and if you want to join this group, I'll create a discord server and update this post in the next few days. Cheers

comments.author: minime0105
comments.body: Bitcoin learning doesn't need to be bridge about Bitcoin learning because one thing i understand in Bitcoin is that once tou leave it education and it will surprisingly leave you also, i believe that what can motivate you seriously to go more about Bitcoin is when you go across of the testimony of people that make alot of profit in Bitcoin and people you know Bitcoin technology before is making absolutely well in Bitcoin, it always astonish when you are not doing well

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: Good job!Those hindrances won't stop you from teaching your friends about bitcoin. Do you check their progress if they already have started to buy little mbtc's from each of them?It's good to invite people outside your circle but I think it's good to focus only on them first and see the progress of each of your friend.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Most of yh active forum users (barring the spammers and bounty hunters), would have a decent understanding of Bitcoin and how it works to not need a regular off forum meeting to improve on their knowledge. And the few who do are welcome to interact here and learn more from the more experienced users; the entire purpose of the forum.Your idea is surely a good one and would be greatly helpful to your friends who need Al the expert guidance they can get as they get their feet wet in Bitcoin, but you might not get a substantial amount of users here willing to join in.Good luck anyways.

comments.author: romero121
comments.body: Really appreciable, because people find it hard to participate into discussion. You've made things clear and requested for two hours of discussion. Everyday two hours of discussion about bitcoin and surrounding incidents will give clear picture about the market. Through the participants it will widespread. Good initiative which could turn OP a good trainer on cryptocurrency.Everyone won't be spend two hours regularly in teaching others. As an user mentioned, in between checking the progress of the participants could help you understand how well you've taught and what changes need to be done to make it more effective.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: It is a good initiative @OP to invite us to join a discord channel in order to discuss Bitcoin and enhance our knowledge about it.  But I believe this forum is enough since the forum is already rich with information both facts and fiction, myth and truth about Bitcoin.  Besides, we are already here discussing current events of Bitcoin's technology, economy, and politics.Quote from: Upgrade00 on November 28, 2022, 09:44:44 PMMost of yh active forum users (barring the spammers and bounty hunters), would have a decent understanding of Bitcoin and how it works to not need a regular off forum meeting to improve on their knowledge. And the few who do are welcome to interact here and learn more from the more experienced users; the entire purpose of the forum.I agree, most forum members here are somehow knowledgeable about Bitcoin so having an extra platform to discuss the same ideas and topics is just a waste of time, IMO, unless we have Bitcoin icons on that Discord Channel that will conduct regular updates, insights and development of Bitcoin.Quote from: Upgrade00 on November 28, 2022, 09:44:44 PMYour idea is surely a good one and would be greatly helpful to your friends who need Al the expert guidance they can get as they get their feet wet in Bitcoin, but you might not get a substantial amount of users here willing to join in.True, I admit I am one of those who is content to discuss bitcoin and cryptocurrency in this forum because I am too lazy to jump from one platform to the other.  Even my social media accounts has been idling for years now.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Good work, but online class, what is the difference between the discussions in the forum and that there is a fixed paragraph on a weekly / monthly basis? there are many bitcoin broadcast, then The benefit lies in the extent of the knowledge of the newcomers and the extent of the listeners’ desire to learn. If you teach 10, they will know 10, and so on.You have decided that it will be a matter of time, so now you do not talk about the borders of your rainy city, you can record the discussions for us to evaluate them.

comments.author: Frankolala
comments.body: OP you have done well for bitcoin and the online weekly class that your are organising for your friends to educate them on Bitcoin. Nothing will ever hinder the learning of bitcoin or the circulation of bitcoin knowledge in the  world sine there will always be an alternative way to teach or give the awareness to people.I hope you are been open to them about the volatile nature of bitcoin and how they can keep their bitcoin holdings safe in a noncustodial wallet because I see that they might want to invest, if it is OK with them. Bitcoin will rule over fiat soon due to the adoption of people even without the government adopting bitcoin as a legal tender. The forum is the best place anyone can get the best knowledge of bitcoin from especially its technical aspect so I will suggest that you can invite more people from your working place or your neighborhood to join the discord channel so that they can also learn from your weekly class

comments.author: Genemind
comments.body: Your friends are lucky to have someone teach them about bitcoin, unlike most people who are already knowledgeable in cryptocurrency started from scratch, and had to learn it by themselves. I hope that you'll get more motivation to continue what you are doing since not everyone is as eager as you in teaching people about cryptocurrency. You might as well invite your friends here in this forum so that they will have more references in learning cryptocurrency. Kudos OP!

comments.author: Flexystar
comments.body: That is a interesting start up and you should actually start with your local community before going all into the big forum. That’s just to have more sense of how your Standard Operating Procedure is going to be. Many times handling big crowd could be challenging. So start small, keep gathering community, keep talking about it over and over again. This should be two process where after some days or weeks your listeners must start asking Back challenging questions about everything you taught. That would be kick start in to know you are on right path. It’s always great to see someone taking efforts to educate others about bitcoin. Keep growing mate

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Your friends will surely appreciate you well for this charity work you have done to them, because this impact will bring a lot of favour to them in future if they will be able to use it well by following the popular strategy buy when the price is low and release when the price is high in the market to earn well. I believe, you teacch them how to keep their personal details secure from scammers because many beginners has experienced some challenges that made them to see Bitcoin as a scam currency because they exposed their personal details to friends in the process of learning.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: re-start on November 28, 2022, 05:15:26 PMSo I decided to start online classes. Every Friday, we have a friendly meeting for 2 hours, and we talk about Bitcoin and all the important events that affect the market.Good initiative to decide to push the classes online for ease sake for all your friends so none get discouraged due to the difficulty in coming to your place to learn. An online class will also ensure that they can learn and consult you quickly from any location. You will need  be very creative with activities to keep their interest up on bitcoins and cryptocurrency in general so they don't become bored with the online classes, out of sight can be out of mind quickly.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: I like it when members here take out time to teach Bitcoin outside this forum. It's best to go virtual if there's a barrier of distance. That's the part I like because it's easier for both the teacher and student(s). If they complain of data, send them data. However, let me quickly add here for OP. Don't be discouraged if after teaching them you discover that not all of them will continue with it. There will be those among them who will have the wrong notion of how Bitcoin should take them out of poverty level immediately they come in contact with it. Once you let them into the truth that it's not a get rich quick scheme, some will develop that lukewarm attitude and will eventually lose interest. Just know this and know peace.

comments.author: isaac_clarke22
comments.body: Quote from: re-start on November 28, 2022, 05:15:26 PM~I recall your thread that I shared my past experience in learning something related in programming, lol. It's really nice that you kept your consistency in teaching your friends about it, since I recall some other users here just create a thread like these and never heard anything from them every since without any conclusion.I would love to know on how did those 3 months in between end up though. Were they now holding Bitcoin? Actively trading? As much as I wanted to join a Discord server, I would have to pass for now.

comments.author: re-start
comments.body: Quote from: livingfree on November 28, 2022, 09:18:02 PMGood job!Those hindrances won't stop you from teaching your friends about bitcoin. Do you check their progress if they already have started to buy little mbtc's from each of them?It's good to invite people outside your circle but I think it's good to focus only on them first and see the progress of each of your friend.Thank you buddy Yes, all my friends now have at least $100 Bitcoin in their wallets. In the third/fourth week, I showed them how to buy bitcoin from an exchange and bought $30 bitcoin to show them how it works. comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: Quote from: re-start on December 01, 2022, 02:15:25 PMThank you buddy Yes, all my friends now have at least $100 Bitcoin in their wallets. In the third/fourth week, I showed them how to buy bitcoin from an exchange and bought $30 bitcoin to show them how it works. Also, they have completely learned how to sell bitcoin and know all the security tips about the wallet.I think It’s great that you’re keeping tabs on them and monitoring their progress as they grow. Also great that they’ve learnt how to purchase and sell bitcoin through exchanges. I just hope you remembered to warn them to take their funds away from the exchanges after each purchase or sales of bitcoin(very important!). comments.author: hyudien
comments.body: Actually, from anywhere you can learn about Bitcoin even if it's from a newspaper or magazine. Today is not as difficult as it used to be but we are still quite unfamiliar with what Bitcoin is. At first glance from 2014 to 2015, I was still quite confused because of technological limitations, well where I live the internet is still uneven. Today, we just need to connect to the internet and use keywords to search for anything we want to know including Bitcoin. There will be thousands of articles that you can read, there are lots of crypto communities that definitely discuss Bitcoin and there is this forum which is certainly more complex and updated about Bitcoin.
